text: is it possible to apply multiple display condition on single field? if yes, than how?

Ok I have something odd happening. I created a custom testimonial module. Once I had it completed I duplicated it made some css changes to give it a different look and feel. Then I placed them both on the same page so my team can compare them. So the top one's css seems to be over riding the bottom ones unless I use !important which then it overrides the top one. I'm confused I thought these were self contained unless we added outside sheets. Am I wrong? I'm working in a sandbox with themes.
If they are using the same classes, they will override.

That is good to know. So if I'm building multiple versions of a module such as a "testimonial" would you suggest using custom classes on each one? I'm going to guess customize each one incase they try to put them on the page to compare the looks. Sounds like a lot of work when building duplicate modules.

Yeah you'd have to do something, maybe just a  class on the main wrapper. Like testimonial-01, testimonials-02. And then have that in your CSS .testimonial-01 .quote

Then all you have to do in clone the module and change the number to 02
That is what I was thinking an easy search and replace. Thanks Bradley.
